title: For Florists, Roses A Nerve-Racking Business Around Valentines Day
teaser: Valentines Day is this one day when one product — a red rose — is worth two or three times more than it is at any other time of the year. If a florist catches that window, he's golden. But the process of getting the roses to is fraught with risk, middlemen, crazy expense and bad weather.
contentencoded: Copyright 2015 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
